message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with a practical challenge in the deployment of massive MIMO technology for 5G mobile communications, specifically the sensitivity of the system to user mobility-induced channel Doppler. The proposed solution involves a novel form of channel prediction method that exploits the specific angle-delay-Doppler structure of the multipath, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the convergence of the prediction error in the context of large numbers of base station antennas and bandwidth, which is a topic related to systems and control (cs.SY). The simulation results involve the use of a realistic channel model in a rich scattering environment, which is a topic related to multimedia (cs.MM) and machine learning (cs.LG).
